title: Transportation Then and Now

vocab.definition: Ways to move people and things from place to place
Something that carries people or things
To go from one place to another

teachingNotes: Show pictures of old and new transportation. Discuss how people traveled before cars. Compare speed and convenience.

sample.question: How do you get to school?
Name a way people travel today.
Name a way people traveled long ago.
What is something that moves on tracks?
What flies in the sky and carries people?
What do we ride on the road with pedals?
Which is faster, a horse or a car?

truefalse.question: Long ago, people rode in cars to get places.
Airplanes can take people far away quickly.
Bikes have engines that make them go.
Trains can carry many people at once.
Walking is a kind of transportation.
A wagon is a modern invention.

multiplechoice.question: What did people use for transportation before cars?
